page.title: 20THE FRANK MONTGOMERY SCHOOL
page.content: After school activities are difficult to run because many children rely on private transport to get home. Sport events after school make it necessary to take players home in the mini-bus. In bad weather the coaches can not get thru' to the villages & the school has to close.{2.FALLING ROLLS} The school opened with 180 pupils & these numbers to 500 in the 1960s.In 1982, due to the rapid expansion of surrounding villages the roll rose to 818. The numbers are now falling & there will be only 4 form entry (usually 6), by 1990 the numbers are expected to drop to 550. When interviewed the Head thought this would be an advantage since staff & pupils can get to know each other better. The disadvantage is that staff will become redundant & less govnmnt funds will be available for new buildings & resources.
